website_summaries.verdict: There's a lot to like with this exterior RV ladder, as it has a good price and quality.
pros: Provides versatility, as it can fit either a straight or contoured RV shape
Easy to secure to the body of the RV
Works nicely for carrying items securely to the next campground
cons: Some people may want tighter gaps between steps near the ground

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder, lacking proper instructions
customer_reviews.text: A very nice item that lacks proper instructions and is poorly packaged, hence 4 starts instead of 5. If you want to cut the ladder, as I had to since I installed the lower mount on the bumper, use a plumbing pipe cutter. I also shortened all 4 standoffs to match the distance from the RV wall at the bumper, so the standoffs needed trimming also. BTW, the screw catches in the standoff can be pushed in further, using a hammer and socket with extension. This is an Amazon link to the pipe cutters, which all make nice clean cuts around the pipe and is a lot easier to use than a hacksaw:
customer_reviews.author: Dan the Saxman

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and certainly can improve upon
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Overall this ladder is a very poor design. If you don't have anything to cut metal, a drill, bandages, and a lot of patience I will guarantee you will have a headache. A very poor design. The steps are supposed to be 12 inches apart and based on the pictures they are. It's not because the area you are supposed to cut is at the hinge. There was a picture here on Amazon where the ladder broke. I can believe that just by how its designed. Instead of cutting the middle, there should be expandable rods at the roof line. The ladder mounted looks sturdy but I'm nervous about climbing it based on the design.
customer_reviews.author: whitewolf

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly but install was difficult
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is intended to do. I am 240 or so and it holds up great and is very sturdy. Beware however, most likely your wall studs on your camper and the cross beams on the roof will not line up, however there are several points to distribute weight. Also you are not supposed to be on your camper roof more than 2 to 3 times per year. Most important point (maybe just me?) is that install was tough and you will need at least 2 people to pull it off.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Bair

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Good ladder. Easy enough install. Easy to follow instructions. I have a curved roof and it was still easy to install. You should put a little dicor under all the mounting hardware though, I did. Now I can climb right up to clean the solar panels quickly and safer.
customer_reviews.author: SALMONSLAYER

customer_reviews.title: This can be made to fit any camper
customer_reviews.text: The ladder on our motor home was damaged. I had to cut a section out to make this ladder the correct length and going up it feels sturdy. The only thing I don't like is where it turns to come down on the roof. That last section isn't stiff and I'm going to need a modification there. That will probably be a metal plate on the roof with the ladder bolted to the plate, The small bracket that is supplied doesn't mount solidly.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best universal ladder!
customer_reviews.text: Guys this ladder is just what I wanted!! Honestly for the money it's worth every penny, I bought this for my schoolbus conversion and at first I was very hesitant to buy because it is allot cheaper than it's competition the lovely thing about this ladder is that you can literally customize it for any vehicle it took me about 30mins to install, I have tested this ladder with many of my family and friends and it can definitely hold weight that's not a concern!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Maestas

customer_reviews.title: Items missing from box
customer_reviews.text: We got our package today and we are missing several things. 1. Two roof mount brackets 8521-BK 2. Two swivel casting (hinges) 8525-BK 3. #10 sheet metal screws (28) #10-24 x 30 mm Bolts & Nuts (6) #10-23 x 37 mm Bolts & Nuts (2) 1LA-401-B LA-401 (Silver Exterior Ladder)
customer_reviews.author: Ed R

customer_reviews.title: Have a little Engineering mind set!
customer_reviews.text: General product, Not just a snap together ladder. I used most of my old parts from roof mounts and stand off brackets as old parts was 4 times stronger then what came in parts kit, cut new stand offs out of extra ladder tubing. I used 3/16 x 1/2 inch pop rivets that made it much stronger then screws. That is how Fleetwood installed from factory. Only reason I bought this manufacture is because I wanted to go back where mounts was from factory this is 11 inch center side to side and others are 12 inch center.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good luck
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are both very hand and have been building things together for 30 years, very well. This ladder took the two of us five hours. The instructions are horrible. A novice could never install it. Even though we got it installed I will never use it as it is unstable and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic RV ladder
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble and install. Just take your time, measure twice, cut once. Assembly directions are not all that great, but by carefully looking at the pieces and comparing them to the picture, you will be ok. Has made getting on our RV roof a piece of cake. Would defintely purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Flyingyou4fun

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement on my Bigfoot camper
customer_reviews.text: I have had my rig in to two different RV dealers and they said a replacement for my damaged one just isn’t available. 18 years I have been using this camper with a bent up ladder! This one worked great and way better quality than the original. Installed it myself.
customer_reviews.author: DPM

customer_reviews.title: Good price to s simple ladder. Can be better quality!
customer_reviews.text: Not the most robust ladder, but it will hold my weight, 180 lbs. Installation is not easy, but it is not super hard. I've learned that mounting all the stand-offs first and go from there. 4 stars based on the quality of the materials. Should be thinker wall tube, and stainless nuts and bolts should be included. Time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: James Tu

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Had to do some clever cutting to get it to fit my 95 Catalina Coachman. Also needed to reuse 2 of the old posts on the top section, since the ones that came were too short for the angle needed to clear the rail on top while connecting to the bottom. It would benefit from the top section being deeper (to clear toprails easier), or providing longer posts to handle more aggressive angles.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Camper ladder.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in two days as stated. The package was damaged but that is the shippers fault. All parts were in tact and instructions were included. Some pictures would make the instructions much better. Installed easily and attached the bottom to the bumper in place of the rear wall which made the ladder very stable. To attach to the bumper it is necessary to cut the bottom of the ladder off. I would recommend this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Eloi

customer_reviews.title: Put this on my truck camper. I contacted my ...
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my truck camper. I contacted my manufacturer first to see if I could do this and they sent a diagram showing where the studs were. I also used a stud finder just to be certain. Since this a universal ladder I had to cut it to length to make it fit my application. I used a pipe tubing cutter for this purpose and it worked very well. It is now on my camper and provides me with access to the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. K

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners... Handy Man skills required
customer_reviews.text: You are going to have to get creative to make this sturdy... I spent about 6 hours reinforcing the brackets that connect to the RV... If you weigh 175 lbs.... NO Problem.... It is lightweight because the size and design on the pads that make contact with the RV skin...
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bond

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid ladder.
customer_reviews.text: After installing it correctly, it’s a nice solid ladder. No plastic load carrying inserts like the original. I modified the roof interface to distribute the load better using 1/8 aluminum plate. You Need a 90 degree drill jig. The one I bought (from Trick Tools) cost as much as the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Lousy instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently Stromberg Carlson takes the least productive person off the clock to write their installation manuals. This is the third and last product i will purchase from this company based solely on their instruction manuals. The products themselves are sturdily built, therefore the extra star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent product cheapest price online fast delivery wORTH THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Excellent easy install ladder to my 89 motor home only problem found the screws would not work properly bought all new screws made lot difference. Took pictures of it in my garage .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Found the ladder very flimsie, had to use as much of the old ladder as I could, I don’t know how it would support 250 lbs, original ladder was reinforced with 3/4 copper pipe at the joints, inside the tubing. Required much re-working to make it work, could of bought some tubing and made a new one much easier!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lee Reid

customer_reviews.title: Cut to Adjust
customer_reviews.text: It was an ok product that has to be cut to fit your RV. Mounting brackets locations aren’t adjustable to you’ll need to drill new holes and fill the old screw holes from your previous ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Good gravy

customer_reviews.title: Work but not great
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and misleading. Says you can extend 18” but doesn’t include extra step. Ok if you want a cheap functional short ladder
customer_reviews.author: Dave n

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my older travel trailer. It was easy to size it up. Pipe cutter are a must to get a nice finished look when you cut it to size. Seems to be strong and took no time to install. Getting everything straight is tricky by your self so another set of eyes would make it even easier. It's a great $60 upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: mlatc3

customer_reviews.title: ladder
customer_reviews.text: seems alright once mounted to RV have used 1 time I weigh 250 + was happy about not falling off
customer_reviews.author: Bill Tarpley

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Came as ordered. Very sharp looking, was worried about supports .They were included.
customer_reviews.author: Don D Butler

customer_reviews.title: Very good RV ladder
customer_reviews.text: Very good ladder, straight forward installation. It is universal so you do have to plan, cut and drill to adapt to your specific RV. Only complaint is that it only comes with two pair of the 5" standoffs. I was only able to use one pair and had to order a pair of the 12" trim to fit standoffs. Being "universal", it should come with adjustable standoffs.
customer_reviews.author: C_R

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ladder arrived with a missing pin, a hardened steel press fit pin, hardly intuitive for DIY fix. The middle section was twisted and very stiff. Which means the standoffs wouldn't work/install very well. It was impossible to twist it back straight again.
customer_reviews.author: Goog

customer_reviews.title: Good secure ladder
customer_reviews.text: The original standoffs may need to be reused, as they will match the contours of the coach. Use a tube cutter for more precise cuts I ended up using the bottom of my original ladder, original standoffs, the adjustable connector joints, and the new ladder for the top half. Good secure ladder. Universal....not so much..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy and not really a lot of room to get your foot gripping on the ladder securely.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Callan

customer_reviews.title: Up to the roof again
customer_reviews.text: It went together fine and looks good a plus I was able to use my existing standoffs. I wonder If I would have been happy with the lesser number of supports that came with the ladder. There was a little modification to be made but siple hand tools resolved the problems.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Bird

customer_reviews.title: Was useless for me
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit the curve of my trailer. Very flimsy product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Krathwohl

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good value
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was all there. It is sturdy enough for me. It required several cuts of tubing and drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Victor C Rose, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: But I had to return it because does not fit my motorhome
customer_reviews.author: G. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder
customer_reviews.text: The description was kind of confusing as to the measurements so it took us awhile to figure out if this was the correct ladder for us. It does take some assembly and quite a bit of time to get it right but it works great on our camper and is very handy
customer_reviews.author: Hueyfan1

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Top brackets very flimsy. You will have to secure them with metal brackets. Add $15 to price for hardware and safety.
customer_reviews.author: derek morrow

customer_reviews.title: thin and uneven rungs but good for price
customer_reviews.text: the rungs are uneven and it is thin metal. fair for price i guess
customer_reviews.author: Legna

customer_reviews.title: While this would be fine for a travel trailer it doesn't work too well ...
customer_reviews.text: While this would be fine for a travel trailer it doesn't work too well with a fifth wheel. It did not come out away from the back far enough and the mounting brackets didn't fit the curvature of the back of my fifth wheel trailer (Keystone Everest). I had to combine the old ladder that was on the trailer with the top portion of this universal ladder. If you are going to replace a ladder, my suggestion would be to get one that originally came with your unit...if you can
customer_reviews.author: Dale Lange

customer_reviews.title: Patience and some skill needed
customer_reviews.text: Took some modifications to get a good fit but once installed it looks great and is very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Ayyyyyyy
customer_reviews.text: Nice as f easy to fully customize, cons no instructions pic on box is as best as it gets. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: LAURA SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install with simple to follow instructions, only complaint is roof mounted brackets could be a little more robust.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong
customer_reviews.text: It's a great looking ladder but I'm afraid I cut it in the wrong place when shortening it. I have two steps that are kinda far apart and the steps do not come off.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheap quality in comparison to our original ladder. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If will fit but you need to cut some tubes so be prepared with tools
customer_reviews.text: If will fit but you need to cut some tubes so be prepared with tools
customer_reviews.author: korchak03

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Easy install & now the old man can get up on the roof. Be careful of where you mount it when you attach!! Roof deck & roof party kit not included, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Short people need a step ladder for access.
customer_reviews.text: Works OK, too short! Can't use bumper as 1st step – must carry a small step ladder to access the first stepr. It is also narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Fine lightweight ladder
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money, I installed it on my 38 foot trailer and have used it several times
customer_reviews.author: Steve Scarborough

customer_reviews.title: This does what I needed and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 42 ft RV. Nice..easy to install and higjly functional.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Second one bought. Good option for strapping on a portable waste tote while traveling, or a need to get on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: mike (Oklahoma)

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together. It would have been nice to have a chance of straight connectors to connect all sections to make even stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Groom

customer_reviews.title: Best Rv ladder ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Rv ladder I'm up on the roof of my Rv all the time now. Very convenient and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Todd P.

customer_reviews.title: ... very solid but for under 200 lbs it works fine, it is very light and well
customer_reviews.text: it does not look very solid but for under 200 lbs it works fine, it is very light and well made
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: ... the ladder it came with 2 sets but would like two additional sets
customer_reviews.text: Where can I buy additional support brackets that go along the sides of the ladder it came with 2 sets but would like two additional sets.
customer_reviews.author: jamie lane

customer_reviews.title: fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: yes it did the trick fit well and replaced the broken ladder I had at the time that I couldn't use so it was worth the price and a deal for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Up on the Roof
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new to us travel trailer and it did not come with a ladder. One of the first items we purchased was this ladder. My husband was able to install it by himself (but it would have been easier with two guys) in about two hours. Everything he needed to secure the ladder was included and it is very secure. It's been used several times already.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ladder for RV
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder for a travel trailer. EASY install with minor modification. ONLY CON is a tad narrow for a big footed guy.
customer_reviews.author: 41Buick

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice when it comes to assembling these things. The instructions were okay but written in a way that require prior knowledge of the sequence required for assembly. After a few minutes of deciphering the instruction sheet, I was able to complete the task. The final assembly was about two hours from start to finish, all without the use of power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to modify and make it fit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to modify and make it fit. A bit flimsy but I think they all are. I would recommend​ it.
customer_reviews.author: Carace Ramos

customer_reviews.title: broke right on union piece
customer_reviews.text: We used it for 1 week before it snapped on my aunt on the joint piece.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Nothing is standard, the ladder is narrower than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is standard, the ladder is narrower than the one I had. The top is longer than the one I had. Also has the extra nut and bolt links to cut the ladder to the proper length.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Product worked good. Had to cut about a foot off each side. It was too long. But it looks good and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hill

customer_reviews.title: this works great but the instructions are made for those of us ...
customer_reviews.text: this works great but the instructions are made for those of us who are handy. I would have given it 5 stars but if you don't have a sawzall or hacksaw and a good handy brain this may stump you. The directions have to be broad for all of the possible places you can place this. Just remember to account for the roof pitch you have! Also SEAL AROUND YOUR SCREWS INTO THE SIDE OF YOUR TRAILER!! Do this at the base of the self driving screw BEFORE you screw it in!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. The Coach dealer wanted $600
customer_reviews.text: This unit matched my RV's ladder, I only used half of the ladder to repair mine. It worked great. The Coach dealer wanted $600.00 this one was $120.00. No Brainer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lou Miller

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, ended up using my old stand offs to make it work. Looked ok after I finished.
customer_reviews.author: John Vmax

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our RV, it works, but takes time to install.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Product was great
customer_reviews.text: Product was great, Didn't work for my trailer No support on back side of trailer. Called keystone direct and they stated they would not recommend putting it on. Put on craigslist and sold it in 4hours.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great. easy to install and fit our camper perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kay

customer_reviews.title: not for all campers
customer_reviews.text: it didn't work on my camper to many things in the way it went out to far on the roof....
customer_reviews.author: axehandlebill

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution to add a ladder to a trailer!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this ladder inside a stacker trailer to be able to get up on to the loft.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald H.

customer_reviews.title: The ladder is very easy to make up and install
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is very easy to make up and install. Once you decide where you are going to install it, cut it to length and fasten it to the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with in days of purchase! Installed very quickly, was easy to modify for our 1984 Nissan Mirage RV, works very well! A very good ladder for the Money
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace the ladder that came with our 5th wheel, well made and best price around.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen V. Gingrich

customer_reviews.title: great value and fit great.
customer_reviews.text: fit perfectly on our 15 year old coach and made a nice upgrade for a very fair price. would buy one again
customer_reviews.author: K. J.

customer_reviews.title: For moving up in the world...
customer_reviews.text: My second one. Works really well until you back into something.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Gaskins

customer_reviews.title: A good ladder
customer_reviews.text: This was inexpensive, but works just like it should on our motorhome. We had checked other places and found the best price through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on the RV. We had someone else mount it!
customer_reviews.author: Irma R. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: good price and a bit tricky but duable install dealer ...
customer_reviews.text: good price and a bit tricky but duable install dealer wanted $450 uninstalled
customer_reviews.author: Irving (Bart)

customer_reviews.title: all in all, this was a suitable replacement for ...
customer_reviews.text: all in all, this was a suitable replacement for our damaged existing ladder. I was unable to acquire an exact replacement, so some placement alteration was required.
customer_reviews.author: Finney Hoke

customer_reviews.title: but it was the best price I could find for a ladder that would've ...
customer_reviews.text: I never actually installed this on my RV, but it would've taken modification with a pipe cutter. I ended up trading in my trailer before installing it, but it was the best price I could find for a ladder that would've done the trick. It may fit perfectly on someone's RV, but it does not fit perfectly without modification on a 2008 Keystone Springdale 266. Keep in miind though..its a universal ladder, so 90% of people will need to do some minor modifications. If you want to pay someone to install it should only be an hour of labor to modify and install.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ladder is ok, was narrower than my o/e ladder on my Keystone Outback but was able to utilize it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It had everything expected but I thought they could have holes drilled already in the middle hinges.
customer_reviews.author: FSankey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works pretty good, but instructions leave a little to be desired. Functionality is great though.
customer_reviews.author: dukiefever

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works as it should and it's holding on for now!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L.

customer_reviews.title: I needed to interpolate the install due to my application but it works great! Keep your spacing equal for the steps and ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my car hauler. It has a funky nose. This worked perfectly. I needed to interpolate the install due to my application but it works great! Keep your spacing equal for the steps and supports and they are solid when complete. I did sleeve a joint I had. A 3.5" long x 3/4" hard copper pipe slides inside the tubes nicely. Installed 3/16" bolts/nuts 90' from each other above and below the joint. It doesn't move. Only the upper rail moves slightly when going up or down which is expected given the large hoop. $20 more than a used set at the RV salvage yard in town. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DaStr8tPoop

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ladder but poor instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is sturdy once installed. Being a universal ladder I thought the braces would match up with the original installed ladder. However, the braces are rectangular verses round and the holes don't line up. The instructions are not real good and it took longer to install because of that. Now that it is installed I have access to the roof without having to carry an external ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Just as I expected
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is great for my rv, installed fairly easy and is strong enough for my 200 lbs. Arrived in great condition no breaks or bends.
customer_reviews.author: Lovd

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: shipper was a little rough on the box but it arrived ok and all of the parts where in the box. it was very easy to remove the old ladder and use this as its replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: It's much lighter than I expected. The light but sturdy aluminum tubing doesn't add much weight to the back of your rig. The installation was straight forward, but you do need to cut the tubes in four places to get the length and step spacing correct. I used white silicone calking on all 8 mounting places to both seal the holes in the skin of my RV and better adhere the ladder to the fiberglass side of the unit. It is nice and sturdy now that the silicone has hardened.
customer_reviews.author: B. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder for the price but not the easiest to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder for the price but not the easiest to assemble when the lengths don't match and the tubes need to be cut.
customer_reviews.author: ocj

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The standoffs were shorter were shorter than the originals, so I had to make some adaptations. The ladder appears to hold my 180 pounds without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Wight

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Now I can access the roof without propping up an extension ladder.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered in good shape and looks good on the back of my Four Winns RV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fit
customer_reviews.text: This generic ladder was hellish to install. I couldn't do it myself, so took it to an RV garage. They said they had a miserable time cutting and adjusting to make it fit my vehicle. So that was a significant additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken and beaten box..
customer_reviews.text: Nice ladder yet big arrived beaten up. The Box was broken open at both ends and there were holes in the Box as well. I'm surprised all the parts were still there.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: The instructions that came with this ladder were so pathetic that I broke into laughter
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that came with this ladder were so pathetic that I broke into laughter. I am a mechanical engineer and my wife is a civil and neither of us could believe that a company could survive putting out such garbage. Oh well, we'll muddle through the installation somehow. I guess that is what the company intended!
customer_reviews.author: v10e

customer_reviews.title: MAJOR SAFETY LIABILITY!!!
customer_reviews.text: My employee almost broke his neck. Fell coming halfway down because stairs just plain broke into half (160lb Guy)!!! We always thought it was flimsy but thought it would hold up but Wow. Thank God it wasn’t worse than a scare and some good bruises. Who knows if he had a hairline fracture!!! Not getting any response on returning this product. It was Professionally installed by a seasoned Contractor we have used for many things including building out two of our food trucks. It’s 3 months old, we are all under 190lbs, barely use it-less than 12 times climbing up and down. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl C.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the ladder is aligned before installing.
customer_reviews.text: Picture does not show 4 supports that comes with it. With the supports the ladder become very sturdy. Be prepared to cut with an hacksaw. You must modify to fit. Be sure to stand back while another person hold the ladder for alignment. Great value for the money. Love the result.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Universal Outdoor Ladder for RV
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking ladder as well as it is constructed, easy to mount. I ended up mounting the bottom to the bumper instead of fooling with the rv contour and it worked out very well. The item shipped on time and was in excellent condition upon arrival, thanks again Amazon
customer_reviews.author: odyhill

customer_reviews.title: ok product....delivered horribly
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy but ya get what ya pay for. Package arrived beat to pieces. ...had been opened and n it bothered to be re-taped, etc
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Step Up
customer_reviews.text: The ladder came in the original box from Stromberg. It was somewhat different from what I had but that was not Amazon's fault. Will order from this site again.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't order till you know it fits
customer_reviews.text: was told it would fit my camper using the same holes as the current one that is bent.. manfacture rep doesn't have a clue what she is talking about.. totally different holes so i have to drill 32 new holes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Stromberg Carlson 139.21 LA-401 Universal Exterior RV Ladder
product_meta.description: Stromberg Carlson LA-401 Universal Exterior RV Ladder. Our Universal RV Ladder can fit on the rear of any RV – straight or contoured. Our rugged construction keeps you safe when going up to do maintenance on the roof or just hanging your chairs on the ladder as you travel to the next camp site.
feature_bullets: All screws connecting the ladder to the RV must be fastened to the RV’s sub frame or backing
